title: Woman, 21, karate-chopped in the FACE after trying to break up a fight at Oktoberfest event in Perth
text:
The accused is a trained martial artist and allegedly wanted to prove his skills

A friend said she was knocked out in one punch, splitting her forehead open

A woman trying to break up a fight at an Oktoberfest celebration was allegedly punched in the face and knocked unconscious by a trained martial artist, as blood oozed down her face.

The 21-year-old was with friends at the event in Perth's Langley Park at 4.30pm on Saturday when the fight broke out between two friends, one of whom was trained in mixed marital arts.

A witness alleged the victim was knocked out in a single punch, splitting her forehead open.

A woman trying to break up a fight at an Oktoberfest celebration was allegedly punched in the face and knocked unconscious by a trained martial artist (pictured)

The woman's best friend expressed her anger, telling The West the martial artist wanted to show off his skills.

She also explained the last thing she expected to be doing that night was sitting in the 'emergency room with my best friend'.

'I need everyone to be aware of what this person has done and what he is capable of,' she said.

The 21-year-old was with friends at the event in Perth's Langley Park at 4.30pm on Saturday when the fight broke out between two friends (pictured: a similar Oktoberfest event)

'This was no accident and there's no excuse ... (I) just wanted to make a simple (point) to simply show people what this person has done to a female.'

A WA Police spokesperson told Daily Mail Australia said an investigation had been launched but no one had been charged over the incident.

The martial arts gym said in a statement that the accused was suspended and banned from training on the premises.
description: A friend alleged the victim was knocked out in a single punch by a trained martial artists at the Perth Oktoberfest celebration, splitting her forehead open.
authors: Charlotte Karp For Daily Mail Australia
